revised_title: The Evolution of Medicine and the Role of Pathology
tldr: In this lecture, Professor Rudolf Virchow discusses the history and evolution of medicine, focusing on the role of pathology among biological studies. He highlights the contributions of key figures like Andreas Vesalius and Paracelsus, and the development of the anatomical and vitalistic approaches in medicine. He also emphasizes the importance of the experimental method in research, as demonstrated by William Harvey's work on the heart and blood circulation.
